citations.narrative:
When contact was made with the facility representative during an unannounced inspection, they confirmed that the
animals were moved to a new location approximately 1.5 weeks prior and had not updated their new site address with
USDA APHIS Animal Care. Failure to notify Animal Care of significant changes in business can interrupt the inspection
process and prevent APHIS Officials from carrying out their duties. A licensee shall notify Animal Care no fewer than 90
days before any change in the name, address, or location of business.
Correct by 8 April 2024.

citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process at 2:04pm on 28-MAR-
2024. The phone number was called and a voicemail left, whereby the facility representative called back right away. The
facility representative stated that the animals and responsible staff had been transferred to a new site approximately 1.5
weeks prior and apologized for not informing APHIS Officials. Failure to provide access to the facility, animals, and
records for inspection is a serious violation of the AWA and regulations. Failure to comply may result in enforcement
action.
End Section

narrative:
2.1(b)(1) 
   
Requirements and application 
When contact was made with the facility representative during an unannounced inspection, they confirmed that the 
animals were moved to a new location approximately 1.5 weeks prior and had not updated their new site address with 
USDA APHIS Animal Care. Failure to notify Animal Care of significant changes in business can interrupt the inspection 
process and prevent APHIS Officials from carrying out their duties. A licensee shall notify Animal Care no fewer than 90 
days before any change in the name, address, or location of business. 
 
Correct by 8 April 2024. 
2.126(b) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process at 2:04pm on 28-MAR-
2024. The phone number was called and a voicemail left, whereby the facility representative called back right away. The 
facility representative stated that the animals and responsible staff had been transferred to a new site approximately 1.5 
weeks prior and apologized for not informing APHIS Officials. Failure to provide access to the facility, animals, and 
records for inspection is a serious violation of the AWA and regulations. Failure to comply may result in enforcement 
action. 
 
 
End Section
